question_sentence: Why did the US government shut down this week?
choices: Lawmakers unable to reach a federal budget deal
evidence: The US government shut down for the first time in six years after a deadlocked Congress failed to pass a funding measure before the deadline. Republicans and Democrats are at odds over enhanced Obamacare subsidies.

question_sentence: Which religious leader this week called on governments worldwide to protect the environment?
evidence: In a speech on Wednesday, Pope Leo XIV called for global action to tackle climate change. He said that damaging the natural world is incompatible with the Christian faith.

question_sentence: Which company said it is taking action to reduce food additives in its private-label products?
evidence: Walmart will remove artificial dyes and 30 other additives — such as artificial sweeteners, fat substitutes and various preservatives — from its US private-brand food and beverage products, the company announced on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Conservationist Jane Goodall was famously known for studying which animals?
evidence: Conservationist Jane Goodall, known for her revolutionary work studying chimpanzees, died this week at the age of 91.

question_sentence: Hundreds of senior military officers were ordered to attend a meeting this week in which state?
evidence: Hundreds of US generals and admirals around the world were called to Virginia for a meeting with Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth. At the unusual gathering, Hegseth outlined his plans to remake the US military in his preferred image.

question_sentence: Which of the following did President Trump target with a 100% tariff this week?
evidence: In an effort to promote American-made entertainment, President Trump said that he will be imposing a 100% tariff "on any and all movies that are made outside of the United States."

question_sentence: A 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck which region this week?
evidence: A deadly 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines on Tuesday. Several buildings collapsed, littering streets with debris.

question_sentence: Which luxury automaker recently recalled nearly 200,000 vehicles due to a potential fire risk?
evidence: BMW told nearly 200,000 vehicle owners to park outside because their cars could short-circuit and catch fire.

question_sentence: An apartment high-rise partially collapsed this week after a massive explosion. Where did the blast occur?
evidence: An explosion at a New York City apartment building blew off a chunk of the high-rise, terrifying residents in the Bronx.

question_sentence: Which fast-food chain announced it is bringing back Monopoly after a decade?
evidence: McDonald’s is rebooting the fan-favorite game in an effort to spur sales.
